main_definition: A common given name, often used as a surname, or an idiom referring to a playful teasing phrase.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A popular male first name derived from the Irish surname O'Ryan
meanings_and_examples.example: My friend Ryan is named after his grandfather who had the last name Ryan.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A variant of the given name Rylan, which can also be a nickname or short form for 'Ryle', an Irish surname meaning 'descendant of Fael Rí'
meanings_and_examples.example: My brother Rylan was often called Ryan by friends and family.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A teasing phrase used to call someone out in a playful manner, similar to saying "Hey you!" or 'hey there!', derived from the name Ryan
meanings_and_examples.example: When I caught my friend sleeping on his desk, I jokingly shouted 'Ryan!' to wake him up.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A slang term used informally in some English-speaking countries, particularly Ireland and the United States, to refer to a person or group of friends
meanings_and_examples.example: The gang gathered at Ryan's house for their weekly game night.
